paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its variants, specifically focusing on the G53A variant, its pathogenicity, and associated clinical data.

functional_data.summary: The G53A TTR variant readily forms amyloid at physiological pH and exhibits cytotoxic activities.
assays: cell viability assays on SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and cytotoxicity data.
variants.source_location: Results and Discussion, paragraph discussing G53A variant.
variants.additional_notes: The G53A variant is associated with a faster formation of cytotoxic oligomers compared to WT TTR.
key_quotes: Notably, the pathogenic TTR variant readily forms amyloid at the physiological pH.
The G53A oligomers appear to have similar cytotoxic activities to those of WT TTR oligomers.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction focused solely on the TTR gene and its variants as specified.
